trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The electrope enthusiast is scrutinizing the machinery.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_TODO_00<tab>Speak with the electrope enthusiast and have him accompany you.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_TODO_01<tab>Accompany the electrope enthusiast to the power converter and then speak with him.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_TODO_02<tab>Accompany the electrope enthusiast to the partitioned water tank and then speak with him.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_TODO_03<tab>Accompany the electrope enthusiast to the control tower and then speak with him.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_TODO_04<tab>Speak with the electrope enthusiast once more.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_000<tab>Well, if it isn't Her Majesty's special guest! Did our electrocapacitor catch your eye?
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_001<tab>The machines here run on electrope, so the capacitor serves as a battery, storing the lightning energy as it rolls in from all the pylons we've erected.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_002<tab>If you're interested, I'd be happy to show you around and tell you more about our system!
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_003<tab>Piqued your curiosity, eh? First, let's head downstairs to see the power converter!
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_SYSTEM_000_006<tab>The electrope enthusiast is now accompanying you. Keep him at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_SYSTEM_000_007<tab>You can leave the electrope enthusiast behind by entering a different area, or by speaking with him and selecting the option to part ways.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_SYSTEM_000_008<tab>If you wish to have the electrope enthusiast join you again, return and speak with him at the original location.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_Q1_000_009<tab>What will you do?
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_A1_000_001<tab>Speak with the electrope enthusiast.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_A1_000_002<tab>Part ways with the electrope enthusiast.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_A1_000_003<tab>Nothing.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_010<tab>It's great to see folks taking an interest in electrope. Any excuse to talk about it is always welcome!
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_Q2_000_011<tab>Are you sure you wish to part ways with the electrope enthusiast?
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_012<tab>Something came up, I take it? Another time, then! If you need to find me, I'll be near the electrocapacitor.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_013<tab>Welcome back! Now, where were we?
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_A1_000_014<tab><var 48 F20224 /var>Ask about the cubical building.<var 48 01 /var>
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_014<tab>That's our food storage facility. By converting lightning energy to ice, we've created a refrigeration system that can prevent spoilage.

TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_015<tab>It's a godssend, I'll tell you that. These parts get a lot of rain and humidity, so if we didn't have refrigeration, we'd have a massive mold problem on our hands.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_016<tab>After lightning energy is absorbed in the electrocapacitor, it's transmitted to this power converter.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_017<tab>Its function is to stabilize and distribute appropriate levels of energy to each household and facility.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_018<tab>...You look lost. Are you more of a visual learner? Let's pay a visit to the partitioned water tank on the north side of town.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_019<tab>Right, so, after lightning energy is allocated to the residential grid, it's utilized in a variety of ways, one of which is that tank there.

TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_020<tab>Normally, it's a receptacle for filtering rainwater. By using electrope to convert the lightning energy to fire, however, we can have hot water readily available at any time!
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_021<tab>Amazing, isn't it? Lastly, let's go and have a look at the control tower just up the stairs.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_022<tab>These panels enable us to freely adjust each of the public utilities individually.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_023<tab>The utility manager monitors the operational status of each facility, keeping an eye out for any problems. Not a glamorous job, but it's important work.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_024<tab>Well, I think that about covers it! Let's loop back around to the electrocapacitor, shall we?
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_025<tab>So, how'd I do? Hopefully I've answered all your most burning questions.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_026<tab>Believe it or not, I'm not actually an engineer─just an apprentice. I was inspecting the capacitor when you arrived.
TEXT_KINGZF003_05151_ADAPTERS05151_000_027<tab>Thanks for letting me ramble, though. It was a great opportunity to brush up on my studies!
